moon.calendar_description: Check moon phases to plan your astronomical tours in the Atacama Desert
moon.why_matters_title: Why does the moon phase matter?
moon.why_matters_description: In the Atacama Desert, the moon phase is crucial for astronomical observation. During a full moon, its brightness can make it difficult to see stars and deep-sky objects. The best times for astronomy are during the new moon or waxing/waning phases.

seo.title: Moon Calendar - Northern Chile Tours
seo.description: Check moon phases to plan your astronomical tours in San Pedro de Atacama. Discover the best dates to observe the sky in the clearest desert in the world.
seo.og_title: Atacama Moon Calendar - Plan Your Astronomical Tour
seo.og_description: Check lunar phases and plan the best date for your astronomical experience in the Atacama Desert with clear skies.

hero.badge: Astronomical tours in the clearest desert in the world
hero.subtitle: Live a unique experience observing the universe in one of the clearest skies on the planet

home.featured_tours_subtitle: Discover the best of the Atacama Desert
home.cta_subtitle: Join us on an unforgettable astronomical adventure

experience.title: More than a tour, a connection
experience.subtitle: In the heart of the world's driest desert, we invite you to gaze at the universe with fresh eyes. Where science, history, and nature merge under the same sky.
experience.astro_desc: You won't just look at stars: you'll learn to read them. Our guides, experts in astronomy and Andean worldview, reveal the secrets of the cosmos and how ancient peoples interpreted it.
experience.geo_desc: Connect with living geology. From the salt mirrors of the Hidden Lagoons of Baltinache to the mineral palette of the Rainbow Valley. Walk upon golden dunes that narrate millions of years of history.

seo.title: About Us - Northern Chile
seo.description: Learn about the history and team behind Northern Chile, your expert guide for astronomical tours in San Pedro de Atacama.
seo.og_description: Learn about the history and team behind Northern Chile

about.title: About Northern Chile
about.subtitle: Connecting people with the universe from the clearest desert in the world
about.historyP1: Northern Chile was born from 15 years of passion for astronomical tourism in the Atacama Desert. We do not simply sell a tour; we sell an experience of knowledge, a true show under the stars.
about.historyP2: We created an "Open-Air Auditorium" where our visitors lie down at the foot of the desert to connect the sky with the ground. It is a natural experience that involves walking through the dunes, equipped with professional telescopes (Celestron 8se, Skywatcher equatorial, Celestron 114 LSM, Seestar S50zvw) and cameras to capture the magic of the moment.
about.historyP3: We were awarded the "Best Tour of Atacama" prize last year, and our agency was selected among the top 9 in San Pedro by tourism representatives. Our founder participated as the voice-over for the astronomical tour at the VIVA Antofagasta fair.
about.historyP4: The Atacama skies are completely different every 6 months, offering unique experiences depending on the time of year. We invite you to discover why the Atacama Desert is considered one of the best places in the world for astronomical observation.

values.experience_description: We don't sell tours, we sell an educational show under the desert stars
values.equipment_description: 4 high-end telescopes and professional cameras for an unforgettable experience
values.quality_description: Awarded as the best Atacama tour and selected among the 9 best in San Pedro
values.auditorium_description: We create an open-air auditorium where you connect the sky with the desert ground

alex.bio: 15 years of experience in astronomical tourism in Bolivia and San Pedro de Atacama. Award for the best tour in Atacama.

credentials.award: Winner of the best Atacama tour award
credentials.voice_over: Voice-over for the astronomical tour at the VIVA Antofagasta fair

david.bio: Specialist in astronomical and night photography. Captures the magic of the Atacama sky combining professional technique and artistic vision.

credentials.art_teacher: Art teacher with a focus on night photography

q1.question: Do I need previous astronomy experience?
q1.answer: No, our tours are designed for all levels. Our guides will explain everything you need to know.

q2.question: What happens if there is bad weather?
q2.answer: We constantly monitor weather conditions. If canceled due to bad weather, we offer rescheduling or full refund.

q3.question: Do tours include transportation?
q3.answer: Yes, all our tours include transportation from your accommodation in San Pedro de Atacama.

q4.question: Can I make a private reservation?
q4.answer: Yes, we offer private tours. Contact us to coordinate a personalized experience.
